intro: Viola setosa, commonly known as the common violet, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring heart-shaped leaves and violet or purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and showy blossoms that bloom in spring. Viola setosa thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and the plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
